$interpreted: Doctor: Enough! How many days has it been? Stop thinking about escaping, you little brat!
Desert Bandit: This one's quite the troublemaker. Is it going to be alright when it's time?
Doctor: I will make sure she behaves before we sell her. It won't cause the customer any trouble.
Desert Bandit: Good to hear that...
Sherlock: Hoho, so this is not an orphanage after all. Turns out it's a damn human trafficking ring!
Doctor: What the...why are you here!?
Sherlock: Lisa left me a present. After giving it some thought, I considered the gift to be way too precious. I don't deserve it.
Sherlock: I visited here with the intention of giving it back to her, and what do you know? I catch you bastards showing your true colors...
Doctor: This little girl is none of your business anymore. If you don't want to end up in the junkyard, I suggest you leave, now!
Sherlock: I don't think so. This transaction was done with undisclosed information. Therefore, it's no longer valid. I'm taking Lisa back right now!
Doctor: In your dreams. You, let out the big dogs. Have them tear this tin can to pieces!
Desert Bandit: Impossible...
Doctor: Damnit! Why are you fighting so hard for one little girl? You treasure her that much?
Desert Bandit: Of course. To me, Lisa is one of the few things I treasure!
Lisa: Treasure...?
Sherlock: For the past month, she gathered customers for me, applied oil to my joints, and talked with me. She even gifted me her treasured Rainbow Roses.
Sherlock: She gave me everything she could have offered. No one has ever treated me with such consideration.
Sherlock: She gave me too much, so much so that I don't know how to measure it. For the sake of a fair trade, I must repay her with things of equal value!
Sherlock: I thought about it real hard. Seems like the only way to do so is to raise her until she is an adult. That way, we're even.

Doctor: A mechanican wants to raise a human child?
Don't be ridiculous; what makes you think you're qualified?
Sherlock: Then I shall rename myself to Sherlock Ortiz Aguilar starting this very moment. That makes me Lisa's father, doesn't it? Am I qualified now?
Doctor: Idiot. Boys, get him!
Sherlock: Lisa, I'm so sorry. I had no idea that doctor was such a scumbag...
Lisa: It's ok...
Lisa: About what you just said...
Sherlock: Oh, you mean me being your father? I need to have an identity so those folks at the Bazaar won't whine about this...
Sherlock: Or do you want me to be a mother instead?
Lisa: ...Father is just fine.
Lisa: You...are my dearest father...
Sherlock: It's too early to be so delighted. I only adopted you for the sake of a fair trade! I am a strict parent, so you better be prepared!
Lisa: Yes!
: Kingdom of the Sun Calander, year 199
Sherlock: Come~ All kinds of rare and obscure treasure can be found here. Come see for yourself~
Lisa: Father~
Lisa: The booth that sells accessories has imported a shipment of really beautiful earrings!
Sherlock: No need to continue, I know! Tell him to put it on my bill. Shop to your heart's content!
Lisa: Got it!
Lisa: Also, there's this booth that sells dresses. The owner said he would only accept cash...

Sherlock: How dare he trouble Sir Sherlock's daughter!?
Go back home and grab the cash! Buy every single dress he has!
Lisa: Roger that~ I love father so much~
Lisa: If there's any spare change, I'll buy you some high-quality motor oil. I'll apply them for you when we get home. Wait for me!
Sherlock: Jeez, she was so quiet when she was a kid. Now, even her personality has changed. Are daughters a type of creature that change this drastically?
Sherlock: But, I guess it feels pretty darn good to have a treasured item that you don't want to give to others. Hohoho~
